SEARCH
Module edu.ntnu.stud.boardgame
Package edu.ntnu.stud.boardgame.core.model

Class BoardGame

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.stud.boardgame.core.model.BoardGame
public class BoardGame extends Object
Represents the board game with players, a board, and dice. This class manages the game state, player turns, and win conditions.

  • Constructor Details

    • BoardGame

      public BoardGame()

  • Method Details

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(Player player)
      Adds a player to the game and places them on the starting tile (tile ID 1).
      Parameters:
      player - The player to add to the game
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player is null

    • createBoard

      public void createBoard()
      Creates the game board with 90 sequentially connected tiles. This method must be called before players can be added to the game.

    • createEmptyBoard

      public void createEmptyBoard()
      Creates an empty board without any connections between tiles. This is used when loading a board configuration from a file.

    • createDice

      public void createDice(int dices)
      Creates dice for the game with the specified number of dice.
      Parameters:
      dices - The number of dice to use in the game
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of dice is less than 1

    • play

      public void play()
      Plays one round of the game, letting each player take a turn. For each player, rolls the dice and moves the player accordingly. If a player reaches tile 90, they win and the game is finished.

    • getWinner

      public Player getWinner()
      Gets the winner of the game.
      Returns:
      The player who has won the game, or null if there is no winner yet

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Checks if the game has finished.
      Returns:
      true if the game has finished, false otherwise

    • getPlayers

      public List<Player> getPlayers()
      Gets a defensive copy of the list of players in the game.
      Returns:
      A new list containing all players in the game

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Gets the game board.
      Returns:
      The game board

    • requireNotNull

      protected void requireNotNull(Object obj, String message)
      Utility method to check if an object is null and throw an exception if it is.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to check for null
      message - The error message to include in the exception if the object is null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the provided object is null
